messages.subject: RE: [AlwaysLearning] RE: Dalmatians (was DC tomorrow)
messages.msgSnippet: Oh, I m dying to respond to all these wonderful pet posts, but alas, I must leave to attend a volunteer appreciation dinner where I must present an award to a
messages.messageBody:
Oh, I'm dying to respond to all these wonderful pet posts, but alas, I
must leave to attend a volunteer appreciation dinner where I must
present an award to a great Guardian Ad Litem. I'll be back later
tonight to write, write, write about Dalmatians and rats, and guinea
pigs and homeschool theatre groups, oh my!

Laurel

-----Original Message-----
From: Karen [mailto:kbmatlock@...]
Sent: Thursday, April 04, 2002 10:48 AM
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [AlwaysLearning] RE: Dalmatians (was DC tomorrow)



>>Three of our
dogs are Dalmatians - the best proof I know that there actually might be
a God,<< Laurel

OK, so where do you get decent Dalmatians? I haven't seen a good one
since
101 (Ways to Overbreed) Dalmatians came out. There was a wave of puppies
when the cartoon video first came out, then another when the live-action
movie came out and IMO it will take years for the breed to recover. Jack
Russells are another breed that's suffered from popularity, and I see a
lot
of people getting them who shouldn't. Not you, you'll do fine! :) I just
wish they'd only use mixed breeds in movies so people wouldn't run out
and
buy the latest fad... ::sigh::

Karen

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] RE: Dalmatians (was DC tomorrow)
messages.msgSnippet: ... There are English Shepherds in commercials, but the people who own them don t usually tell the breed; they ll say it s a mix or let people assume it s a
messages.messageBody:
on 4/4/02 7:48 AM, Karen at kbmatlock@... wrote:

> I just
> wish they'd only use mixed breeds in movies so people wouldn't run out and
> buy the latest fad... ::sigh::

There are English Shepherds in commercials, but the people who own them
don't usually tell the breed; they'll say it's a mix or let people assume
it's a border collie. English Shepherds have the opposite problem of most
dog breeds -- too few, not too many. There are about 600 individuals, many
of the neutered, and some tendency to hip dysplasia. The last thing the
breed needs is popularity; just look what "Babe" did to border collies!!

Nancy, hoping the non-pet people aren't bored to tears ;-)


--
Outside of a dog, a book is probably man's best friend; inside of a dog,
it's too dark to read.
-- Groucho Marx
